question.title: Find Peak Element
prompt: A peak element in an array is an element that is greater than its neighbors. Given an input array {{ nums }}, where {{ nums }}[{{ i }}] ≠ {{ nums }}[{{ i + 1 }}] for all valid {{ i }}, find a peak element and return its index.
You may imagine that {{ nums[-1] = nums[n] = -∞ }}. You must write an algorithm that runs in {{ O(log n) }} time complexity.

explanations: The output index 2 is the peak's index.
The output index 5 is the peak's index.

constraints: nums[i] ≠ nums[i+1] for all valid i
hints: Try to solve it in O(log n) time complexity.
